stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream refining the desert/cowboy level: tweaking quick-sand visuals, experimenting with fog and distant cliff backdrops, and live-profiling performance on real N64 hardware. He also discusses forthcoming engine optimisations and team status.

development_findings.summary: Quicksand edges looked ugly; Kaze experimented with combiners, shade alpha and fog fades, finally deciding to blend the pit into a solid sand-coloured fog rather than blue sky.
development_findings.quote: There is the obvious solution of just fade everything into blue at the bottom… but I think fading into sand keeps the distance illusion.

development_findings.summary: He introduced far-off billboard cliffs on a second render layer to add depth; used fog-coloured prim shading to match the skybox and avoid render-distance artefacts.
Colour mismatch arose because level fog and skybox fog were using slightly different saturation; he reduced overall fog saturation and re-exported textures to align both layers.
development_findings.quote: The actual level fog is applying to this and ruining the colour… so we decreased the saturation and now it finally matches.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 kept overwriting manual hex edits; short-term fix is importing already colourised textures until a better workflow is found.
Large moving textures (e.g., shimmering sand) were rejected as they would double overdraw and be too expensive on N64.
development_findings.quote: That's so expensive to render… you’re basically overdrawing everything twice, you can’t do that on the N64.

development_findings.summary: Culling was accidentally disabled for the entire level; simply toggling it back on will immediately raise FPS.
development_findings.quote: Wait, we’re not culling any of these buildings here – how the fuck is it running?

development_findings.summary: Live test showed 25-30 FPS on real hardware before culling or F3DX3; confident of solid 30 FPS after culling planes and new microcode.
Sauraen is writing a new F3DX3 variant that shifts work from RSP after discovering RTYI is now RSP-bound instead of RDP-bound.
development_findings.quote: He thinks that in Return to Yoshi’s Island the memory and RDP is so optimised that the RSP becomes the bottleneck.

development_findings.summary: Dynamic lighting is still on the roadmap and will be added once geometry and performance budgets settle.
Considering ultra-high-resolution sand textures because the new approach eliminates previous tiling issues.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design method is highly iterative: 'you just have to try, see what happens'.
context_findings.quote: These are the kind of things where you just have to try, see what happens, see how it turns out.

context_findings.summary: Strong priority on player readability – worries players might think they should drop into the quicksand pit, so visuals must clearly communicate danger.
Expresses irritation with YouTube drama content and values ignoring rage-bait.
context_findings.quote: I don't get rage-baited, I just get annoyed that it's there, that it's infiltrating my world.

context_findings.summary: Excitement about pushing 30-year-old hardware and comparing favourably to Banjo-Tooie’s scope.

biobak.summary: Currently unresponsive; was expected to help rework several levels.
biobak.quote: Dude, has anyone seen Biobak recently? He wanted to help me rework a bunch of levels.

badub.summary: Holds primary responsibility for the entire soundtrack; other composers are being declined.
badub.quote: The reason you are not the first person to ask to compose for RTYI is because Badub wants to make all of it.

zeina.summary: Acts as a play-tester; Kaze mentions having her play on April Fools.
zeina.quote: I have my wife play it too on April Fools.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Desert Fog Mismatch
key_stories.summary: The new distant cliffs looked wrong because their colour diverged from the level’s fog. Kaze traced the issue to two separate fog calculations and rebuilt the colour pipeline.
key_stories.challenge: Skybox and geometry colours clashed, breaking immersion.
key_stories.process: Tested multiple textures, swapped combiners, then tweaked fog saturation and re-exported assets.
key_stories.outcome: A cohesive backdrop that clearly separates walkable ground from void.
key_stories.key_quote: We decreased the saturation of the fog so now the fog matches exactly this colour.

key_stories.title: When Optimisation Backfires
key_stories.summary: Adding F3DX3 actually slowed only Kaze’s copy of the hack. Investigation with Sauraen revealed RTYI had become RSP-limited.
key_stories.challenge: Unexpected FPS drop after an allegedly faster microcode.
key_stories.process: Profiling, consultation with Sauraen, hypothesis that memory/RDP savings moved workload to RSP.
key_stories.outcome: Sauraen is developing an RSP-lighter F3DX3; expected major boost.
key_stories.key_quote: Return to Yoshi's Island is so optimised the RSP becomes the bottleneck.

key_stories.title: Where’s Biobak?
key_stories.summary: The team’s primary artist has been absent, causing concern about pending level re-works.
key_stories.challenge: Missing contributor jeopardises planned graphical polish.
key_stories.process: Kaze publicly wonders about his whereabouts during stream.
key_stories.outcome: Status unresolved; Kaze plans to message him.
key_stories.key_quote: It’d be really unfortunate for the Kaze empire if he's gone.
